node.title: Open fire season now in place for most of upper North Island
node.description: There is now an open fire season in most parts of the upper North Island.

node.title: Over $7m in assets seized over 613kg meth bust
node.description: Police have confiscated more than $7 million in assets in relation to New Zealand's largest meth bust, when 613kg of the drug was seized at Auckland Airport this month.

node.title: Northland councils voice strong support for renewable energy zone pilot
node.description: Northland local government is strongly in favour of Tai Tokerau becoming New Zealand's first renewable energy zone pilot.

node.title: Charges laid after school fight video appears to show woman waving fake gun
node.description: Police have charged a 20-year-old woman with carrying a fake gun with criminal intent and threatening to cause grievous bodily harm, after a video surfaced of a school fight in which a woman is seen…

node.title: Troy Kotsur becomes first Deaf man to win acting Oscar
node.description: His costar in the film, Marlee Matlin, was the first Deaf actor to ever win an Oscar, winning in 1987 for "Children of a Lesser God."

node.title: Dame Jane Campion wins best director Oscar for 'Power of the Dog'
node.description: Dame Jane Campion has received the Academy Award for best director for "The Power of the Dog," becoming the third woman in the Oscars' 94-year history to take home the prize.

node.title: Tourism workers excited, ready to welcome visitors to New Zealand
node.description: Former tourism workers are taking the plunge back into the hard-hit industry, saying they cannot wait to welcome back visitors.

node.title: Two police officers shot dead in Israel gun attack
node.description: Two Arab gunmen killed two police officers in Israel on Sunday and were then shot dead, as the US secretary of state and three Arab foreign ministers visited the country for a summit.

node.title: Jane Campion wins best director Oscar for 'Power of the Dog'
node.description: Jane Campion has received the Academy Award for best director for "The Power of the Dog," becoming the third woman in the Oscars' 94-year history to take home the prize.

node.title: Will Smith smacks Chris Rock on Oscar stage
node.description: About 30 minutes later, Will Smith won the Oscar for Best Actor.

node.title: 'It did change everything' - Simon Bridges on why he's quitting politics
node.description: Former National Party leader Simon Bridges has revealed more about his reasons for retiring from politics in a magazine interview.

node.title: China announces Shanghai Covid lockdown
node.description: Shanghai will be locked down in two phases, in China's biggest city-wide lockdown since the Covid outbreak began.

node.title: Call for volunteers ends in search for missing doctor David Holland
node.description: Bay of Plenty doctor David Holland, 31, did not show up for work on 11 March after he was believed to have gone swimming.

node.title: Community boards would be ‘great step forward’ in Hamilton
node.description: 'Give Hamilton communities a voice' is the message from a Waikato Māori leader who believes community boards in Hamilton would be a great step forward.

node.title: Shooting to wound 'something from the movies' - Coster
node.description: After RNZ obtained a secret IPCA report that sheds light on the Armed Offenders Squad, Police Commissioner Andrew Coster denies 'shoot to kill' policy.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on March 27, 2022
node.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Rep. Adam Kinzinger and Marie Yovanovitch join John Dickerson.

node.title: Ariana DeBose makes history as the first openly queer actor of color to win an Oscar
node.description: The actress won Best Supporting Actress for her performance in Steven Spielberg's version of "West Side Story."

node.title: Ukraine says Russia wants to split nation, calls for more arms
node.description: Ukraine war: Ukraine's military intelligence chief says Russia wants to split Ukraine in two; officials clarify the US does not have a policy of regime change in Russia; Zelensky calls for more…

node.title: Beyonce opens 2022 Oscars with first live performance in two years
node.description: After two years away, Queen Bey returned in a big way by performing "Be Alive," which was nominated for best original song.

node.title: Councillor quartet rejects Northland regional landfill's statement of intent
node.description: A quartet of councillors has refused to fully support the operation of Northland's major regional landfill south of Whangārei.

node.title: Higher pay not enough to retain staff - Seek
node.description: The tight labour market and skills shortage was a challenge for would-be employers, with record low unemployment of 3.2 percent and annual wage growth the strongest since 2009.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Hollywood gears up for its biggest night
node.description: Hollywood is gearing up for its biggest night of the year, as the stars get ready to attend the 94th Academy Awards in Los Angeles later - and NZ-filmed The Power of the Dog is a frontrunner.

node.title: Hundreds more may die in first Omicron wave, Covid-19 modeller says
node.description: The Covid-19 death toll stands at 258 as of Sunday evening, but a modeller says hundreds more people could die in the first wave of the Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Govt boosts Air NZ pandemic support by up to $180 million
node.description: Air New Zealand is getting another 12 months of government support for cargo flights as the pandemic continues to disrupt international air passenger travel.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Red carpet arrivals at the 94th Academy Award
node.description: From Zoë Kravitz to Venus Williams, here's who showed up in a big way.

node.title: Erebus memorial: Ministry acted unreasonably by not consulting more widely on location - Chief Ombudsman
node.description: Site preparation began for the Auckland-based memorial in December.

node.title: House January 6 committee report recommends Trump aides be held in contempt of Congress
node.description: The full committee will vote on the recommendation on Monday.

node.title: Shortage of supplies hampering support of isolating Covid-19 cases in Taranaki
node.description: Taranaki has been averaging more than 600 new Covid-19 cases a day and there are about 4500 active cases in the community - 10 percent of which need support to isolate safely.

node.title: Auckland Council gets set to kick-off consultation on Māori seats
node.description: Auckland Council will start formal consultation with iwi and urban Māori from next month on the creation of Māori seats in time for the 2025 election.

node.title: Ukraine still fighting back a month after Russia began its invasion
node.description: Holly Williams reports from Ukraine, where Russia's ground invasion has been largely stymied by Ukrainian counter-attacks.
